title: Epic: UI Polish & Configuration
description:
## Epic: UI Polish & Configuration

**Priority:** P2 (Normal)
**Sprint:** 4 (Week 4-5)
**PRD Reference:** FR-8, FR-9, FR-10, FR-11

### Overview
Configurable UI, file watching, MCP integration, theming.

### Key Features
- YAML config for sections
- File system watcher
- Polling fallback
- MCP integration (optional)
- Catppuccin Mocha theme
- Icon library

title: Enhance config with section management
description:
## Task: Enhance Config with Section Management

Add section enable/disable and ordering to configuration system.

### Deliverables
- SectionConfig struct (enabled, order)
- Config validation
- Section filtering by enabled flag
- Section sorting by order

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Config supports sections.enabled map
- [ ] Config supports sections.order array
- [ ] Filter disabled sections
- [ ] Sort sections by order
- [ ] Provide default ordering when not specified

title: Implement file system watcher
description:
## Task: Implement File System Watcher

Use fsnotify to watch transcript and .beads files for changes.

### Deliverables
- File watcher using fsnotify
- Watch targets: transcript, .beads/issues.jsonl
- Event handler for file changes
- Channel-based notification

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Watch Claude Code transcript
- [ ] Watch .beads/issues.jsonl
- [ ] Send change notification on modify
- [ ] Trigger refresh on change
- [ ] Handle watch errors gracefully
- [ ] Support multiple watch targets

title: Add polling fallback
description:
## Task: Add Polling Fallback

Implement 300ms polling fallback when file watching fails.

### Deliverables
- Polling ticker (300ms)
- Watch failure detection
- Automatic fallback to polling
- Watch recovery detection

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detect watcher failure
- [ ] Fall back to 300ms polling
- [ ] Periodically attempt to recover watcher
- [ ] Switch back to watcher on recovery
- [ ] Smooth transitions (no flickering)

title: Implement MCP client (optional)
description:
## Task: Implement MCP Client (Optional)

Add optional MCP server integration for enhanced data.

### Deliverables
- MCP client struct
- Server detection from Claude Code config
- Query function for MCP data

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detect MCP servers from settings.json
- [ ] Query MCP for additional context

- [ ] Degrade gracefully if MCP unavailable
- [ ] Log MCP errors to stderr only

title: Epic: Core Infrastructure & Architecture
description:
## Epic: Core Infrastructure & Architecture

**Priority:** P1 (High)
**Sprint:** 1 (Week 1-2)
**PRD Reference:** FR-10, FR-12, FR-13

### Overview
Establish the foundational architecture for Claude HUD Enhanced in Go.

### Key Features
- Go project initialization with module structure
- YAML-based configuration system
- Section registry factory pattern
- Basic statusline rendering
- Graceful error handling

### Deliverables
- Go module with proper structure
- Config system (~/.config/claude-hud/config.yaml)
- Section registry for extensibility
- Statusline rendering framework
- Error handling that never crashes

title: Initialize Go project structure
description:
## Task: Initialize Go Project Structure

Create the foundational Go project structure for Claude HUD Enhanced.

### Deliverables
- Go module initialized (go.mod)
- Directory structure: cmd/, internal/, pkg/
- Main entry point in cmd/claude-hud/
- Makefile for build automation
- .gitignore for Go artifacts

### Relevant Files
- Makefile (reference from other projects in dotfiles)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `go mod init github.com/ll931217/claude-hud-enhanced`
- [ ] Directories created: cmd/, internal/config, internal/registry, pkg/
- [ ] Main.go with basic hello world
- [ ] `go build` succeeds
- [ ] .gitignore excludes .bin/, *.exe, go.sum

title: Implement YAML configuration system
description:
## Task: Implement YAML Configuration System

Create config system that loads from ~/.config/claude-hud/config.yaml with embedded defaults.

### Deliverables
- Config struct with all fields
- YAML loader with sensible defaults
- Config file path detection (~/.config/claude-hud/config.yaml)
- Embedded default config as fallback

### Relevant Files
- .config/starship/starship.toml (config patterns to follow)
- .config/worktrunk/config.toml (YAML/TOML patterns)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Load config from ~/.config/claude-hud/config.yaml
- [ ] Provide embedded defaults when file missing
- [ ] Support section enable/disable
- [ ] Support section ordering
- [ ] Support color customization
- [ ] Config loading never crashes (graceful degradation)

title: Create section registry factory
description:
## Task: Create Section Registry Factory

Implement factory pattern for registering and creating statusline sections dynamically.

### Deliverables
- Section interface (Render(), Enabled(), Order())
- SectionRegistry with Register() and Create()
- Built-in section types: session, beads, git, resources, directory
- Factory function for config-driven creation

### Architecture Patterns
- Factory Pattern for section creation
- Registry Pattern for type lookup
- Interface Segregation (small Section interface)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Section interface defined
- [ ] Register(sectionName, sectionFunc) works
- [ ] Create(sectionName, config) returns Section
- [ ] All 5 section types registered
- [ ] Sections can be enabled/disabled via config
- [ ] Sections ordered by config.Order()

title: Implement basic statusline renderer
description:
## Task: Implement Basic Statusline Renderer

Create the main statusline rendering engine that composes and displays sections.

### Deliverables
- Statusline struct with sections
- Render() method that composes sections
- Output to stdout (Claude Code statusline API)
- Line-based rendering (multi-line support)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Statusline renders all enabled sections
- [ ] Each section on separate line
- [ ] Empty sections not rendered
- [ ] Output compatible with Claude Code statusline API
- [ ] Refresh cycle implemented (300ms default)
- [ ] Graceful handling of render errors

title: Add error handling framework
description:
## Task: Add Error Handling Framework

Implement graceful error handling that never crashes the statusline.

### Deliverables
- Error logging to stderr
- Error wrapper with context
- Graceful degradation for missing data
- Panic recovery in main goroutine

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All errors logged to stderr
- [ ] Statusline continues on render errors
- [ ] Missing config doesn't crash
- [ ] Missing data sources show placeholder
- [ ] Panic recovery in main loop
- [ ] Debug mode for troubleshooting
